intro: Styphelia conchifolia, commonly known as the pink snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It is a low-growing, evergreen shrub that typically reaches a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, which bloom in late winter to early spring. Styphelia conchifolia thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to coastal climates with high salt exposure. It is often found in heathlands and is an important component of the local flora in its habitat.
